DOC.HEAD: French Priest, Niece Freed By Bandits
DOC.TEXT: Moslem bandits released a French missionary and his niece on New Years Eve, a day after they were kidnapped in the lawless southern Philippines, officials said Monday. The Rev. Michel de Gigord and his 29-year-old niece, Benedict, were freed unharmed Sunday night after negotiations between the kidnappers and local officials, military and civilian authorities said. They were handed over to Roman Catholic officials and were expected to leave for France as soon as possible. The two were abducted by six armed men Saturday after leaving Saint Mary's Convent in Marawi, 510 miles southeast of Manila. The incident occurred in a lawless region where hundreds of people have been kidnapped in recent years. Official records show no one has ever been convicted in any of the kidnappings despite government promises to restore law and order.
